TrainingDetails.Title: Manipulating The Left Navigation
TrainingDetails.BodyCopy:
Getting a Navigation

   Any pages made outside of a homepage should not contain a navigation. In order to create a web page with a navigation you must ether have your homepage selected in the CMS tree, or you can select any CMS item located under the homepage. Then you can create a new web page with a navigation.

   If you do not have a homepage, an authorized user will need to create a homepage for you.

  

The Left Accordion

   The left Accordion is populated to mimic the CMS tree structure. All web pages and component items listed under your homepage will be listed within the left accordion. The left accordion will not display folders and the content contained in folders. To prevent components and web pages from displaying in the left accordion, place them within folders.

   Be informed that not all web page types have a left accordion.

 

Highlighted Links

   There is a component called the "Highlighted Links Component" This component allows CMS users to create a list of external, internal (CMS web pages), and document links. This list of links will be located beneath the left accordion.

    Remember these links will not display correctly if a name for each link is not provide.

   Be informed that if you wish to use a highlighted links component you must assign the component to your web page.

 

The University Ad

   The university ad located under the left navigation is mandatory and cannot be removed.
